messageBody:
On Sun, 2 Feb 2003, Steven Taschuk wrote:

> I do wonder, however, why the second method (i.e., the original
> one before the testability question came up) requires a
> ConnectionFactory in the first place. If the code's use of the
> factory is as simple as the above example suggests, why not write
> a Connection proxy which grabs a real connection from the pool as
> needed?

Because it would be quite a lot of work to save just this one line of code:

Connection con = factory.getConnection();

BTW, "as needed" means basically you grab the connection on first use,
and keep it until it's closed. Connections contain state (temporary
tables, transaction state, etc.) and thus can't be returned to the pool
until the client indicates it's done.
